channel.title: Climate and Society
channel.description: Recent content on Climate and Society

item.title: A River Reborn
item.description: The story of the Coonamessett river in Cape Cod could have been one of a group of humans dismantling a natural environment. In the last three centuries, the Coonamessett has been profoundly modified. First, by the creation of dams blocking the river done by the grist mill industry. Later, by the sanding of the river for growing cranberries. However, this isnâ€™t just a story about how people managed to disrupt a nice flowing river so badly that all that was left was a bunch of scattered ponds.
